segment.source: MD Mac OS X configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Mac OS X configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Mac OS X configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Mac OS X configuration policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Use the Mac OS X general configuration policy to configure settings for:
segment.target: Use the Mac OS X general configuration policy to configure settings for:

segment.source: Device security settings - Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.
segment.target: Device security settings - Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.

segment.source: Compliant and noncompliant apps - Specify a list of apps that are compliant, or not compliant in your company.
segment.target: Compliant and noncompliant apps - Specify a list of apps that are compliant, or not compliant in your company.

segment.source: The Noncompliant Apps Report can be used to view the compliance of apps you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).
segment.target: The Noncompliant Apps Report can be used to view the compliance of apps you specified in the list against the apps that users have installed (but cannot actually block the installation of the app).

segment.source: Create an Mac OS X general configuration policy
segment.target: Create an Mac OS X general configuration policy

segment.source: To provide basic settings for the configuration policy
segment.target: To provide basic settings for the configuration policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.

segment.source: Click Mac OS X > General Configuration and then click Create Policy.
segment.target: Click Mac OS X > General Configuration and then click Create Policy.

segment.source: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.
segment.target: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.

segment.source: You must create a custom policy.
segment.target: You must create a custom policy.

segment.source: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.
segment.target: In the General section of the Create Policy page, specify a name and a description for the new policy.

segment.source: Use the information in the following sections to help you supply settings for the policy.
segment.target: Use the information in the following sections to help you supply settings for the policy.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Save Policy.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Save Policy.

segment.source: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.
segment.target: The new policy displays in the Configuration Policies node of the Policy workspace.

segment.source: Settings for Mac OS X devices
segment.target: Settings for Mac OS X devices

segment.source: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this list, you might be able to create it using a Mac OS X custom policy that lets you import settings you created using the Apple Configurator Tool.
segment.target: If the setting you are looking for does not appear in this list, you might be able to create it using a Mac OS X custom policy that lets you import settings you created using the Apple Configurator Tool.

segment.source: For more information, see Mac OS X custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information, see Mac OS X custom policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Password settings
segment.target: Password settings

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Require a password to unlock devices
segment.target: Require a password to unlock devices

segment.source: Specifies whether the use must use a password to access their Mac computer.
segment.target: Specifies whether the use must use a password to access their Mac computer.

segment.source: Unlike iOS devices, on Mac OS X devices, the user is not immediately notified to update their password to comply with this setting.
segment.target: Unlike iOS devices, on Mac OS X devices, the user is not immediately notified to update their password to comply with this setting.

segment.source: Required password type
segment.target: Required password type

segment.source: Specifies whether the password used can be Numeric only, or whether it must be Alphanumeric (contain letters and numbers).
segment.target: Specifies whether the password used can be Numeric only, or whether it must be Alphanumeric (contain letters and numbers).

segment.source: This setting is only supported on Mac OS X version 10.10.3 and later.
segment.target: This setting is only supported on Mac OS X version 10.10.3 and later.

segment.source: Number of complex characters required in password
segment.target: Number of complex characters required in password

segment.source: Specifies the number of complex characters required in the password (from 0 - 4).
segment.target: Specifies the number of complex characters required in the password (from 0 - 4).

segment.source: A complex character is a symbol, such as '?'
segment.target: A complex character is a symbol, such as '?'

segment.source: Minimum password length
segment.target: Minimum password length

segment.source: Specifies the minimum length for the password (between 4 and 14 characters).
segment.target: Specifies the minimum length for the password (between 4 and 14 characters).

segment.source: Allow simple passwords
segment.target: Allow simple passwords

segment.source: Allows the use of simple passwords such as '0000' or '1234'.
segment.target: Allows the use of simple passwords such as '0000' or '1234'.

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before password is required
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before password is required

segment.source: Specifies how long the computer must be inactive before a password is required to unlock it.
segment.target: Specifies how long the computer must be inactive before a password is required to unlock it.

segment.source: Password expiration (days)
segment.target: Password expiration (days)

segment.source: Specifies how many days elapse before the user must change the password (from 1 - 255 days).
segment.target: Specifies how many days elapse before the user must change the password (from 1 - 255 days).

segment.source: Remember password history
segment.target: Remember password history

segment.source: This setting is used to prevent the user from using a previously used password.
segment.target: This setting is used to prevent the user from using a previously used password.

segment.source: When it is set, you can also set Prevent reuse of previous passwords to specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be reused (from 1 - 24).
segment.target: When it is set, you can also set Prevent reuse of previous passwords to specify the number of previously used passwords that cannot be reused (from 1 - 24).

segment.source: Minutes of inactivity before screensaver activates
segment.target: Minutes of inactivity before screensaver activates

segment.source: Specifies the length of time the computer must be idle before the screensaver activates.
segment.target: Specifies the length of time the computer must be idle before the screensaver activates.

segment.source: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps
segment.target: Settings for compliant and noncompliant apps

segment.source: In the Compliant & Noncompliant Apps list for Mac OS X, enable Managed settings for devices, and then specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps using the following information:
segment.target: In the Compliant & Noncompliant Apps list for Mac OS X, enable Managed settings for devices, and then specify a list of compliant or noncompliant apps using the following information:

segment.source: A single policy can only contain a list of compliant, or a list of noncompliant apps.
segment.target: A single policy can only contain a list of compliant, or a list of noncompliant apps.

segment.source: You cannot specify both in the same policy.
segment.target: You cannot specify both in the same policy.

segment.source: lets you report devices with noncompliant apps.
segment.target: lets you report devices with noncompliant apps.

segment.source: It does not block installation, or remove noncompliant apps.
segment.target: It does not block installation, or remove noncompliant apps.

segment.source: Setting name
segment.target: Setting name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps
segment.target: Report noncompliance when users install the listed apps

segment.source: Lists the Mac OS X apps that users are not allowed to install.
segment.target: Lists the Mac OS X apps that users are not allowed to install.

segment.source: If users install any of these apps, they will be reported in the Noncompliant Apps Reports.
segment.target: If users install any of these apps, they will be reported in the Noncompliant Apps Reports.

segment.source: Report noncompliance when users install apps which are not listed
segment.target: Report noncompliance when users install apps which are not listed

segment.source: Lists the Mac OS X apps that users are allowed to install.
segment.target: Lists the Mac OS X apps that users are allowed to install.

segment.source: If users install any other apps, they will be reported in the Noncompliant Apps Reports.
segment.target: If users install any other apps, they will be reported in the Noncompliant Apps Reports.

segment.source: Add
segment.target: Add

segment.source: Adds an app to the selected list.
segment.target: Adds an app to the selected list.

segment.source: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the bundle ID of the app.
segment.target: Specify a name of your choice, optionally the app publisher, and the bundle ID of the app.

segment.source: Import Apps
segment.target: Import Apps

segment.source: Imports a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
segment.target: Imports a list of apps you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

segment.source: Use the format, app name, publisher, app bundle ID in the file.
segment.target: Use the format, app name, publisher, app bundle ID in the file.

segment.source: Edit
segment.target: Edit

segment.source: Let’s you edit the name, publisher and app bundle ID of the selected app.
segment.target: Let’s you edit the name, publisher and app bundle ID of the selected app.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Deletes the selected app from the list.
segment.target: Deletes the selected app from the list.

segment.source: To find the bundle ID of an app, use the following steps on a Mac computer that has the app installed:
segment.target: To find the bundle ID of an app, use the following steps on a Mac computer that has the app installed:

segment.source: Open the folder in which the app is installed (for example, /Applications)
segment.target: Open the folder in which the app is installed (for example, /Applications)

segment.source: Select the <App Name>.app bundle, and choose Show Package Contents
segment.target: Select the <App Name>.app bundle, and choose Show Package Contents

segment.source: Open the Info.plist file
segment.target: Open the Info.plist file

segment.source: Check the value associated with the key CFBundleIdentifier
segment.target: Check the value associated with the key CFBundleIdentifier

segment.source: The format for Bundle ID is com.contoso.appname
segment.target: The format for Bundle ID is com.contoso.appname

segment.source: For more information about reports, see Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports.
segment.target: For more information about reports, see Understand Microsoft Intune operations by using reports.

segment.source: Deploy the configuration policy
segment.target: Deploy the configuration policy

segment.source: Deploy the configuration policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the configuration policy to one or more groups of users or devices in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see UUse policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see UUse policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: When a Mac OS X device is in Sleep mode, policies and profiles cannot be delivered or inventoried.
segment.target: When a Mac OS X device is in Sleep mode, policies and profiles cannot be delivered or inventoried.

segment.source: As a result, the console might temporarily display the status Policy settings in error until the next time the device wakes from Sleep mode.
segment.target: As a result, the console might temporarily display the status Policy settings in error until the next time the device wakes from Sleep mode.

segment.source: Monitor compliant and noncompliant apps
segment.target: Monitor compliant and noncompliant apps

segment.source: Use the Noncompliant Apps Reports to view the compliance of apps you specified.
segment.target: Use the Noncompliant Apps Reports to view the compliance of apps you specified.

segment.source: To run the report
segment.target: To run the report

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Reports > Noncompliant Apps Reports.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Reports > Noncompliant Apps Reports.

segment.source: Select the device groups that you would like to check, whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, then click View Report.
segment.target: Select the device groups that you would like to check, whether you want to check for compliant apps, noncompliant apps, or both, then click View Report.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
